thread.title: Bella Thorne, Bella Hadid stranded at airport after plane hits fence | USA | Tra
thread.title_full: Bella Thorne, Bella Hadid stranded at airport after plane hits fence | USA | Tra

author: torontosun.com
title: Bella Thorne, Bella Hadid stranded at airport after plane hits fence | USA | Tra
text:
Actress Bella Thorne has shared her flight delay drama on Twitter.com after her plane hit a wall at an airport, leaving her stranded for 14 hours.
The 'My Own Worst Enemy' star was on a flight from New York's John F. Kennedy Airport on Saturday to London, when the Virgin Atlantic plane was grounded after its wing hit a fence. She was with boyfriend Greg Sulkin and model Bella Hadid, who also documented the delay.
our flight crashed into a fence this morning so we had to get off and wait for another flight
â€” bella thorne (@bellathorne) September 19, 2015
There were no injuries, but Thorne tweeted her dismay about the incident to her followers, writing, "Our flight crashed into a fence this morning so we had to get off and wait for another flight... Just hoping this flight business gets sorted out to we can safely be on our way... All so tired from being stranded since 6 am..."
by the way, there were several other flights and options on other airlines, in a normal situation, you would just get on another flight.
â€” bella thorne (@bellathorne) September 19, 2015
so virgin gets into an accident and leaves us stranded at the airport for 14 hours with no where to rest and no other options for flight.
â€” bella thorne (@bellathorne) September 19, 2015
Thorne posed for pictures with fans at the airport during the delay, and retweeted them on her Twitter.com account. She went on to reveal that Virgin Atlantic staff had apologized, and the actress later confirmed she had finally made it to London. She posted, "VirginAtlantic has apologized for the inconvenience today, they will look into what happened and try to avoid this situation in the future. Thank you Delta for a great flight, hello London!"
A Virgin Atlantic spokesperson says, "The VS26 departing from JFK to London Heathrow today returned to the gate after a miscalculation by the tug caused minor damage to one of its wing tips.
"Safety is our number one priority and we would like to apologize for the delay and any inconvenience caused."
. @VirginAtlantic has apologized for the inconvenience today, they will look into what happened and try to avoid this situation in the future
â€” bella thorne (@bellathorne) September 20, 2015
Thank you @Delta for a great flight ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§ hello London
